page.title: 06BURGHLEY :KITCHEN GARDENS
page.content: We went to the Kitchen Gardens at Burghley Park. When we got there some of us drew the house.It is a large old house which is now empty.Part of it is an old apple store.At present it is being restored.The house is made of Barnack Ragstone and the roof of Blue Slate.We were about to go when Mrs Smith came.Her son rents the cottage and garden at the back of the Kitchen Garden House.He has a market stall from which he sells plants.She told us how the workmen had decreased from twenty men working on the house to only two.The greenhouses at the back of the house are now dangerous.Her son uses the Kitchen Gardens for horticulture.
